page.title: 20Police Dog Training
page.content: Part of the function of Merseyside {Police College}is to train{Police Dogs and their handlers. Merseyside Police Dogs are usually obtained from the public. This is because some tear curtains or chew furniture. They are either German Shepherd Dogs or {Alsatians.}They train 7 hours a day and 2 nights a fortnight. They start training at 9.00 a.m. and finish at 4.00 p.m. After 13 weeks of hard training they are true Police Dogs. Their{food}consists of a giant tin of dog food and a pound of biscuits a day, and they drink water or occasionally, milk. So far all 65 dogs have passed their test on the obstacle course. The dogs are usually retired after 8 or 9 years service. AHMAD AHMADO.
